   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %%% Purpose : Test records.
   23: 
   24: -module(record_SUITE).
   25: 
   26: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   27: 
   28: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   29: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2,
   30: 	 init_per_suite/1,end_per_suite/1,
   31:          errors/1,record_test/1,eval_once/1,
   32:          nested_in_guard/1]).
   33: 
   34: -export([debug/0]).
   35: 
   36: suite() ->
   37:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   38:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   39: 
   40: all() -> 
   41:     cases().
   42: 
   43: groups() -> 
   44:     [].
   45: 
   46: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   47:     Config.
   48: 
   49: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   50:     Config.
   51: 
   52: 
   53: cases() -> 
   54:     [errors, record_test, eval_once, nested_in_guard].
   55: 
   56: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   57:     test_lib:interpret(?MODULE),
   58:     Config.
   59: 
   60: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   61:     ok.
   62: 
   63: init_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   64:     test_lib:interpret(?MODULE),
   65:     true = lists:member(?MODULE, int:interpreted()),
   66:     Config.
   67: 
   68: end_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   69:     ok.
   70: 
   71: -record(foo, {a,b,c,d}).
   72: -record(bar, {a,b,c,d}).
   73: -record(barf, {a,b,c,d,e}).
   74: 
   75: errors(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   76:     Foo = #foo{a=1,b=2,c=3,d=4},
   77:     #foo{a=19,b=42,c=3,d=4} = update_foo(Foo, 19, 42),
   78: 
   79:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,bar},_}} = (catch update_foo_bar(Foo, 19)),
   80:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,bar},_}} = (catch update_foo_bar(Foo, 19, 35)),
   81:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,bar},_}} = (catch update_foo_bar(Foo, 19, 35, 17)),
   82:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,bar},_}} = (catch update_foo_bar(Foo, 19, 35, 17, 42)),
   83: 
   84:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,barf},_}} = (catch update_foo_barf(Foo, 19)),
   85:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,barf},_}} = (catch update_foo_barf(Foo, 19, 35)),
   86:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,barf},_}} = (catch update_foo_barf(Foo, 19, 35, 17)),
   87:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,barf},_}} = (catch update_foo_barf(Foo, 19, 35, 17, 42)),
   88:     {'EXIT',{{badrecord,barf},_}} = (catch update_foo_barf(Foo, 19,
   89: 							   35, 17, 42, -2)),
   90: 
   91:     ok.
   92: 
   93: update_foo(#foo{}=R, A, B) ->
   94:     R#foo{a=A,b=B}.
   95: 
   96: update_foo_bar(#foo{}=R, A) ->
   97:     R#bar{a=A}.
   98: 
   99: update_foo_bar(#foo{}=R, A, _B) ->
  100:     R#bar{a=A,b=A}.
  101: 
  102: update_foo_bar(#foo{}=R, A, _B, C) ->
  103:     R#bar{a=A,b=A,c=C}.
  104: 
  105: update_foo_bar(#foo{}=R, A, _B, C, D) ->
  106:     R#bar{a=A,b=A,c=C,d=D}.
  107: 
  108: update_foo_barf(#foo{}=R, A) ->
  109:     R#barf{a=A}.
  110: 
  111: update_foo_barf(#foo{}=R, A, _B) ->
  112:     R#barf{a=A,b=A}.
  113: 
  114: update_foo_barf(#foo{}=R, A, _B, C) ->
  115:     R#barf{a=A,b=A,c=C}.
  116: 
  117: update_foo_barf(#foo{}=R, A, _B, C, D) ->
  118:     R#barf{a=A,b=A,c=C,d=D}.
  119: 
  120: update_foo_barf(#foo{}=R, A, _B, C, D, E) ->
  121:     R#barf{a=A,b=A,c=C,d=D,e=E}.
  122: 
  123: 
  124: -define(TrueGuard(Expr), if Expr -> ok; true -> ct:fail(failed) end).
  125: -define(FalseGuard(Expr), if Expr -> ct:fail(failed); true -> ok end).
  126: 
  127: record_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  128:     true = is_record(#foo{}, foo),
  129:     false = is_record(#foo{}, barf),
  130:     false = is_record({foo}, foo),
  131: 
  132:     true = erlang:is_record(#foo{}, foo),
  133:     false = erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf),
  134:     false = erlang:is_record({foo}, foo),
  135: 
  136:     false = is_record([], foo),
  137:     false = is_record(Config, foo),
  138: 
  139:     ?TrueGuard(is_record(#foo{}, foo)),
  140:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(#foo{}, barf)),
  141:     ?FalseGuard(is_record({foo}, foo)),
  142: 
  143:     ?TrueGuard(erlang:is_record(#foo{}, foo)),
  144:     ?FalseGuard(erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf)),
  145:     ?FalseGuard(erlang:is_record({foo}, foo)),
  146: 
  147:     ?FalseGuard(is_record([], foo)),
  148:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(Config, foo)),
  149: 
  150:     %% 'not is_record/2' to test guard optimization.
  151: 
  152:     ?FalseGuard(not is_record(#foo{}, foo)),
  153:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(#foo{}, barf)),
  154:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record({foo}, foo)),
  155: 
  156:     ?FalseGuard(not erlang:is_record(#foo{}, foo)),
  157:     ?TrueGuard(not erlang:is_record(#foo{}, barf)),
  158:     ?TrueGuard(not erlang:is_record({foo}, foo)),
  159: 
  160:     Foo = id(#foo{}),
  161:     ?FalseGuard(not erlang:is_record(Foo, foo)),
  162:     ?TrueGuard(not erlang:is_record(Foo, barf)),
  163: 
  164:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(Config, foo)),
  165: 
  166:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(a, foo)),
  167:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record([], foo)),
  168: 
  169:     %% Pass non-literal first argument.
  170: 
  171:     true = is_record(id(#foo{}), foo),
  172:     false = is_record(id(#foo{}), barf),
  173:     false = is_record(id({foo}), foo),
  174: 
  175:     true = erlang:is_record(id(#foo{}), foo),
  176:     false = erlang:is_record(id(#foo{}), barf),
  177:     false = erlang:is_record(id({foo}), foo),
  178: 
  179:     NoRec1 = id(blurf),
  180:     NoRec2 = id([]),
  181: 
  182:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(NoRec1, foo)),
  183:     ?TrueGuard(not is_record(NoRec2, foo)),
  184: 
  185:     %% Force the use of guard bifs by using the 'xor' operation.
  186: 
  187:     False = id(false),
  188:     ?TrueGuard(is_record(#foo{}, foo) xor False),
  189:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(#foo{}, barf) xor False),
  190:     ?FalseGuard(is_record({foo}, foo) xor False ),
  191: 
  192:     ?TrueGuard(is_record(Foo, foo) xor False),
  193:     ?FalseGuard(is_record(Foo, barf) xor False),
  194: 
  195: 
  196:     %% Implicit guards by using a list comprehension.
  197: 
  198:     List = id([1,#foo{a=2},3,#bar{d=4},5,#foo{a=6},7]),
  199: 
  200:     [#foo{a=2},#foo{a=6}] = [X || X <- List, is_record(X, foo)],
  201:     [#bar{d=4}] = [X || X <- List, is_record(X, bar)],
  202:     [1,#foo{a=2},3,5,#foo{a=6},7] =
  203: 	[X || X <- List, not is_record(X, bar)],
  204:     [1,3,5,7] =
  205: 	[X || X <- List, ((not is_record(X, bar)) and (not is_record(X, foo)))],
  206:     [#foo{a=2},#bar{d=4},#foo{a=6}] =
  207: 	[X || X <- List, ((is_record(X, bar)) or (is_record(X, foo)))],
  208:     [1,3,#bar{d=4}] =
  209: 	[X || X <- List, ((is_record(X, bar)) or (X < 5))],
  210: 
  211:     MyList = [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}],
  212:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList, is_record(X, foo)],
  213:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, not is_record(X, foo)],
  214:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList, begin is_record(X, foo) end],
  215:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, begin not is_record(X, foo) end],
  216:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, is_record(X, foo) or
  217: 				       not is_binary(X)],
  218:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, not is_record(X, foo) or
  219: 				       not is_binary(X)],
  220:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList, is_record(X, foo) or is_reference(X)],
  221:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList, not is_record(X, foo) or
  222: 			     is_reference(X)],
  223:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  224: 				   begin is_record(X, foo) or
  225: 					     not is_binary(X) end],
  226:     [#foo{a=3},x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  227: 				   begin not is_record(X, foo) or
  228: 					     not is_binary(X) end],
  229:     [#foo{a=3}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  230: 			begin is_record(X, foo) or is_reference(X) end],
  231:     [x,[],{a,b}] = [X || X <- MyList,
  232: 			 begin not is_record(X, foo) or
  233: 				   is_reference(X) end],
  234: 
  235:     {_R, 2} = check_bindings(#foo{}, 4),
  236: 
  237:     [a,b,c,d] = record_info(fields, foo),
  238:     5 = record_info(size, foo),
  239:     Foo2 = id(#foo{a=v1, b=true, c=false, d=v4}),
  240:     2 = #foo.a,
  241:     #foo.a = 2,
  242:     5 = #foo.d,
  243:     #foo.d = 5,
  244:     v1 = Foo2#foo.a,
  245:     v4 = Foo2#foo.d,
  246: 
  247:     ?FalseGuard(Foo2#foo.a == baz),
  248:     ?FalseGuard(Foo2#foo.c),
  249:     ?FalseGuard(Foo2#foo.a),
  250: 
  251:     ?TrueGuard(Foo2#foo.b),
  252:     ?TrueGuard(Foo2#foo.d == v4),
  253: 
  254:     ?FalseGuard(element(#foo.d, Foo2) == baz),
  255:     ?FalseGuard(element(#foo.d, Foo2)),
  256:     ?FalseGuard(element(#foo.c, Foo2)),
  257: 
  258:     ?TrueGuard(element(#foo.a, Foo2) == v1),
  259:     ?TrueGuard(element(#foo.b, Foo2)),
  260:     ok.
  261: 
  262: check_bindings(R0, Int) ->
  263:     R = R0#foo{a=(X=Int div 2)},
  264:     {R, X}.
  265: 
  266: eval_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  267:     once(fun(GetRec) ->
  268: 		 true = erlang:is_record(GetRec(), foo)
  269: 	 end, #foo{}),
  270:     once(fun(GetRec) ->
  271: 		 (GetRec())#foo{a=1}
  272: 	 end, #foo{}),
  273:     once(fun(GetRec) ->
  274: 		 (GetRec())#foo{a=1,b=2}
  275: 	 end, #foo{}),
  276:     once(fun(GetRec) ->
  277: 		 (GetRec())#foo{a=1,b=2,c=3}
  278: 	 end, #foo{}),
  279:     once(fun(GetRec) ->
  280: 		 (GetRec())#foo{a=1,b=2,c=3,d=4}
  281: 	 end, #foo{}),
  282:     ok.
  283: 
  284: once(Test, Record) ->
  285:     put(?MODULE, 0),
  286:     GetRec = fun() ->
  287: 		     put(?MODULE, 1+get(?MODULE)),
  288: 		     Record
  289: 	     end,
  290:     Result = Test(GetRec),
  291:     case get(?MODULE) of
  292: 	1 -> ok;
  293: 	N ->
  294: 	    io:format("Evaluated ~w times\n", [N]),
  295: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  296:     end,
  297:     Result.
  298: 
  299: nested_in_guard(_Config) ->
  300:     B = #bar{d = []},
  301:     F = #foo{a = B},
  302: 
  303:     ok = do_nested_in_guard(#foo{a=#bar{d=[]}}),
  304:     not_ok = do_nested_in_guard(#foo{a=#bar{}}),
  305:     not_ok = do_nested_in_guard(#foo{a={no_bar,a,b,c,d}}),
  306:     not_ok = do_nested_in_guard(#foo{a={bar,a}}),
  307:     not_ok = do_nested_in_guard(42),
  308:     not_ok = do_nested_in_guard(#bar{}),
  309:     not_ok = do_nested_in_guard([]),
  310: 
  311:     ok.
  312: 
  313: -define(is_foo(X), (((X#foo.a)#bar.d == []))).
  314: 
  315: do_nested_in_guard(F) ->
  316:     if
  317:         ?is_foo(F) ->
  318:             ok;
  319:         true ->
  320:             not_ok
  321:     end.
  322: 
  323: id(I) ->
  324:     I.
  325: 
  326: debug() ->
  327:     %% Used for interactive debugger to see that step and next behaves
  328:     %% decent
  329:     _A00 = #foo{},
  330:     A0 = #foo{a=d1, c=d3},
  331:     A1  = A0#foo{a=1},
  332:     A2 = A1#foo{a=A1#foo.a+1, b=1, d=id(1)},
  333:     A2#foo{a=1,
  334:            b=2,
  335:            c=3}.
